hints.title: QSD Spatial Density
hints.content:
242: :label: prop-qsd-spatial-density
243: 
244: At QSD, the spatial density satisfies:
245: 
246: $$
247: \rho_{\text{QSD}}(x) \propto \exp\left(-\frac{U(x) + \Delta V_{\text{clone}}(x)}{k_B T_{\text{eff}}}\right)
248: $$
249: 
250: where $\Delta V_{\text{clone}}(x)$ is an effective potential from cloning, related to the fitness $\Psi(x)$.
251: 
252: **Heuristic Derivation**:
253: 
254: The Langevin operator alone would give:
255: 
256: $$
257: \rho_{\text{Langevin}}(x) \propto e^{-U(x) / k_B T}
258: $$
259: 
260: The cloning operator with birth rate $\propto e^{\alpha \Psi(x)}$ and death rate $\propto e^{-\alpha \Psi(x)}$ effectively creates a **potential bias**:
261: 
262: $$
263: \Delta V_{\text{clone}}(x) \sim -\alpha \Psi(x)
264: $$
265: 
266: (Walkers are born more often at high $\Psi$ and die more often at low $\Psi$, creating an effective attraction to high-fitness regions.)
267: 
268: Combining both:
269: 
270: $$
271: \rho_{\text{QSD}}(x) \propto \exp\left(-\frac{U(x) - \alpha \Psi(x)}{k_B T_{\text{eff}}}\right)
